eu.smartdatalake.simsearch

Class Coordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.Coordinator

  • public class Coordinator
extends Object
    Orchestrates multi-attribute similarity search and issues progressively ranked aggregated top-k results. Available ranking methods: Threshold, No Random Access, Partial Random Access. Provides four basic functionalities: (1) Mounting: establishes data connections and prepares indices for the specified attribute data; (2) Catalog: lists all attributes available for similarity search queries; (3) Delete: removes attribute data source(s) from those available for similarity search; (4) Search: handles multi-facet similarity search requests. Extra data connections (along with possible indexing) can be established even in case queries have been previously submitted against other attributes.

        private boolean existsIdentifier(DatasetIdentifier q)
        Checks if a data source has already been specified on the requested facet (i.e., attribute in a dataset).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True, if identifier exists; otherwise, False.

        Returns:

      • findDataSource

        private DataSource findDataSource(String key)
        Identifies whether a data source (to a directory of a JDBC connection to a database) of an attribute is already defined.
        Parameters:
        key - A unique identifier of the data source, usually specified by the administrator.
        Returns:
        An instance of a DataSource object representing the details of the connection.

      • mount

        public Response mount(String jsonFile)
        Mounting stage: Determining the data sources (CSV files or JDBC connections) of the attributes to be used in searching. This method accepts a file with the configuration settings.
        Parameters:
        jsonFile - Path to the JSON configuration file of the data sources, attributes and operations to be used in subsequent search requests.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding any issues occurred during mounting of the specified attribute data sources.

      • mount

        public Response mount(org.json.simple.JSONObject mountConfig)
        Mounting stage: Determining the data sources (CSV files or JDBC connections) of the attributes to be used in searching. This method accepts a configuration formatted as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        mountConfig - JSON configuration file of the data sources, attributes and operations to be used in subsequent search requests.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding any issues occurred during mounting of the specified attribute data sources.

      • mount

        public Response mount(MountRequest params)
        Mounting stage: Determining the data sources (CSV files or JDBC connections) of the attributes to be used in searching. This method accepts a configuration formatted as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters specifying the data sources, attributes and operations to be used in subsequent search requests.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding any issues occurred during mounting of the specified attribute data sources.

      • index

        public void index(MountSpecs attrConfig,
                  DatasetIdentifier id,
                  JdbcConnector jdbcConn)
        Indexing stage: Build all indices and keep in-memory arrays of (key,value) pairs for all indexed attributes. This method accepts a configuration formatted as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        attrConfig - Specifications for reading attribute values and creating indices to be used in subsequent search requests.
        id - Identifier of the dataset containing attribute values.
        jdbcConn - JDBC connection details for querying data in-situ from a DBMS.

      • delete

        public Response delete(String jsonFile)
        Discard all structures (indices, in memory look-ups) created on the given attribute(s) according to user-specified configurations.
        Parameters:
        jsonFile - Path to the JSON configuration file of the attributes and operations to be removed.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding the removed attribute(s) or any issues occurred during their removal.

      • delete

        public Response delete(org.json.simple.JSONObject removeConfig)
        Discard all structures (indices, in memory look-ups) created on the given attribute(s) according to user-specified configurations.
        Parameters:
        removeConfig - JSON configuration for attributes and operations to be removed; these must have been previously specified in a mount request.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding the removed attribute(s) or any issues occurred during their removal.

      • delete

        public Response delete(RemoveRequest params)
        Discard all structures (indices, in memory look-ups) created on a given attribute according to user-specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - Parameters specifying the attributes and operations to be removed; these must have been previously specified in a mount request.
        Returns:
        Notification regarding the removed attribute(s) or any issues occurred during their removal.

      • listDataSources

        public AttributeInfo[] listDataSources()
        Catalog with the collection of all attributes available for querying; each dataset is named after a particular attribute.
        Returns:
        An array of all attribute names including their supported similarity search operations.

      • listDataSources

        public AttributeInfo[] listDataSources(String jsonFile)
        Provides a catalog with the collection of attributes available for querying; if an operation is specified, only relevant attributes will be reported. This method accepts a file with the configuration settings.
        Parameters:
        jsonFile - Path to the JSON configuration file that specifies an operation.
        Returns:
        An array of attribute names including their supported similarity search operation(s).

      • listDataSources

        public AttributeInfo[] listDataSources(org.json.simple.JSONObject catalogConfig)
        Provides a catalog with the collection of attributes available for querying; if an operation is specified, only relevant attributes will be reported. This method accepts a configuration formatted as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        catalogConfig - JSON configuration that specifies a CatalogRequest operation.
        Returns:
        An array of attribute names including their supported similarity search operation(s).

      • listDataSources

        public AttributeInfo[] listDataSources(CatalogRequest params)
        Provides a catalog with the collection of attributes available for querying; if an operation is specified, only relevant attributes will be reported. This method accepts an instance of CatalogRequest class.
        Parameters:
        params - An instance of a CatalogRequest class; if not null, it should specify a string for similarity search operation (categorical_topk, spatial_knn, numerical_topk)
        Returns:
        An array of attribute names along with the supported similarity search operation(s).

      • search

        public SearchResponse[] search(String jsonFile)
        Searching stage: Given a user-specified configuration, execute the various similarity search queries and provide the ranked aggregated results. This method accepts a file with the configuration settings.
        Parameters:
        jsonFile - Path to the JSON configuration file that provides the multi-facet query specifications.
        Returns:
        A JSON-formatted response with the ranked results.

      • search

        public SearchResponse[] search(org.json.simple.JSONObject searchConfig)
        Searching stage: Given a user-specified configuration, execute the various similarity search queries and provide the ranked aggregated results. This method accepts a configuration formatted as a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        searchConfig - JSON configuration that provides the multi-facet query specifications.
        Returns:
        A JSON-formatted response with the ranked results.

      • search

        public SearchResponse[] search(SearchRequest params)
        Searching stage: Given a user-specified configuration, execute the various similarity search queries and provide the ranked aggregated results. This method accepts an instance of SearchRequest class.
        Parameters:
        params - An instance of SearchRequest class with the multi-facet search query specifications.
        Returns:
        A JSON-formatted response with the ranked results.
